page.title: 03Derivation: Ceres,Pitscottie
page.content:
The origin of the name Ceres is uncertain. It could have originated from Roman invasions because it is identical to the name of the Goddess of Harvest. In the early seventeenth century it was 'Seres' and before that it was 'Syres'. It may have come from the Latin word 'Syrus' meaning 'marshy ground near a running stream.' It could also have been named after St. Cyrus or the Syras family.
A local legend suggests that the name 'Pitscottie' might have originated from a Gaelic word which sounded like 'Pitscottie' and meant 'The land with the little flock'. Some non-Gaelic speakers heard this word and thought it was the name of the hamlet.
